title: About EPIC-lab
text: The EPIC-lab (Evaluating Policy Implications with Causal-inference) is committed to advancing the science of causal inference to address pressing societal challenges. We believe that rigorous causal analysis is essential for evidence-based policy making and effective interventions.

title: About EPIC-lab
text:
What We Do
We specialise in:

Methodological Innovation: Applying robust designs and methods to observational and experimental data.
Applied Research: Collaborating with partners to evaluate real-world policies and interventions
Open Science: Creating accessible tools and resources for the broader research community
Education: Training the next generation of causal inference researchers

title: About EPIC-lab
text:
Our Approach
We combine cutting-edge statistical methods with domain expertise to:

Identify and state clearly defined causal questions (harder than it seems!)
Design studies that can answer these questions
Apply robust analytical techniques
Communicate findings clearly

title: EPIC-lab
text:
Understanding what truly drives human behavior is complex. When governments and organizations launch new programs, whether aimed at improving mental health, reducing prejudice, or encouraging sustainable choices, how do we know if they are actually working?
The EPIC-Lab specialises in distinguishing correlation from causation. We leverage methods for causal inference and causal machine learning to provide rigorous, data-driven answers to critical questions in psychological science and public policy. We are interested in quantitatively evaluating whether interventions work, for whom, and in which contexts.
The EPIC-lab is based at the School of Psychological Sciences at Victoria University of Wellington‚ÄîTe Herenga Waka. It is led by Prof.¬†Joseph Bulbulia.

Our Mission
We‚Äôd like to:

Advance causal inference methodology in the social sciences, both in observational research and experimental design.
Bridge theory and practice by developing accessible tools for social scientists

Promote evidence-based decision making through robust causal analysis

title: Team
text:
Joseph Bulbulia



Director, EPIC-lab
üìß joseph.bulbulia@vuw.ac.nz
üîó University Profile
Joseph Bulbulia is a Professor at the School of Psychology at Victoria University of Wellington, New Zealand. He leads the EPIC-lab and directs the Centre for Applied Cross-Cultural Research (CACR).
His research interests include religion, cooperation, and conflict, with a specialisation in methodologies for inferring causality from observational data.






New Zealand Attitudes and Values Study (NZAVS): Joseph is one of four members of the senior leadership team for the NZAVS, a longitudinal study that has measured the attitudes and values of 76,490 New Zealanders since 2009.
Pulotu Database: He is a founding investigator for the Pulotu database. This project encompasses 116 Austronesian cultures and was purpose-built to study the evolution of religious beliefs and rituals during Pacific expansions and settlements.




Joseph supervises students in a broad range of areas, including:

Personality and individual differences
Political psychology
Multi-dimensional well-being




When not working, Joseph is an avid distance runner.

title: About EPIC-lab
text:
Our Mission
We bridge the gap between advanced quantitative methodology, psychological theory, and real-world application in New Zealand and globally.

Innovate: advance causal inference methodology to address the unique challenges of psychological and behavioral research.
Impact: partner with agencies and NGOs to rigorously evaluate the effectiveness of social and behavioral interventions.
Empower: develop and disseminate accessible statistical tools tailored for applied researchers and practitioners.
Train: mentor the next generation of psychological scientists in methods for causal inference and machine-learning.
